result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

State moves to DRI the charges in this case.

Defendant Rodrick D Grant in court with attorney Kelly Iselin.  Defendant Rodrick D Grant in custody.  Erika Frank Motsch appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter Amy Schneider.
Def is requesting a Jury trial on 15CM2430.
15CM2376 to track along.
  Jury trial scheduled for March 24, 2016 at 08:30 am.  Status conference scheduled for March 15, 2016 at 08:30 am.  Status conference scheduled for February 15, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Pre-trial conference at 11-19-2015 03:15 pm.
Status conference at 12-21-2015 08:30 am.

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions:  No contact with the victim, ST (person, property, residence or family).   It is a condition of this bond that the defendant NOT consume or possess any  alcohol.  This is to be monitored by random UA's and/or breathalyzers.  The defendant is to report to Zimmerman Consulting Inc. (ZCI) for monitoring - report to 524 Main Street, Suite 302, Racine, WI  53403 (third floor of the Monument Square Building) or call (262)632-1780 to immediately schedule an appointment.  The defendant is further ordered to report for testing after each court appearance. Make all court appearances on time.  Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.

Defendant Rodrick D Grant in court with attorney Gregory Austin Holdahl.  Defendant Rodrick D Grant in custody.  Lillian V. Lewis appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter Mark Garvin.  Reading of complaint is waived, probable cause found, p-ng, bond set.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for November 19, 2015 at 03:15 pm.  Status conference scheduled for December 21, 2015 at 08:30 am.
